intro: Brachyscome oncocarpa, commonly known as the yellow star bush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are arranged in dense, star-like clusters, making it a visually striking addition to gardens. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions and dry sclerophyll forests.
